subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms}}
[[File:Nu Front Hong Kong.jpg|thumb|Usage of {{lang|zh|駅}} in Hong Kong along with a [[superscript]] gloss of {{m|zh|站}}.]]

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: {{obor|zh|ja|-}} {{ja-r|駅|えき}}, read either etymologically as {{zh-l|驛|jik6}} or semantically as {{zh-l|站|zaam6}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text: This character is used in place names in Hong Kong for stylistic effect; it is also used for faithful rendition of Japanese place names.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{ja-pron|えき|acc=a|y=on|acc_ref=NHK}}

Note: When used as a suffix, the accent falls on the last syllable of the place name.<ref>{{Template:R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>

subSections.title: Compounds
Derived terms
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|道の駅|みち の えき}}
* {{ja-r|海の駅|うみ の えき}}
